<a id="PhysicalSkyMaterial"></a>

# PhysicalSkyMaterial

**Inherits:** [Material](Material.md) **\<** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

A material that defines a sky for a [Sky](Sky.md) resource by a set of physical properties.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

The **PhysicalSkyMaterial** uses the Preetham analytic daylight model to draw a sky based on physical properties. This results in a substantially more realistic sky than the [ProceduralSkyMaterial](ProceduralSkyMaterial.md), but it is slightly slower and less flexible.

The **PhysicalSkyMaterial** only supports one sun. The color, energy, and direction of the sun are taken from the first [DirectionalLight3D](DirectionalLight3D.md) in the scene tree.

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="PhysicalSkyMaterial_property_energy_multiplier"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **energy_multiplier** = `1.0` [ðŸ”—](#PhysicalSkyMaterial_property_energy_multiplier)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_energy_multiplier**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_energy_multiplier**\ (\ )

The sky's overall brightness multiplier. Higher values result in a brighter sky.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicalSkyMaterial_property_ground_color"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Color](Color.md) **ground_color** = `Color(0.1, 0.07, 0.034, 1)` [ðŸ”—](#PhysicalSkyMaterial_property_ground_color)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_ground_color**\ (\ value\: [Color](Color.md)\ )
- [Color](Color.md) **get_ground_color**\ (\ )

Modulates the [Color](Color.md) on the bottom half of the sky to represent the ground.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicalSkyMaterial_property_mie_coefficient"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **mie_coefficient** = `0.005` [ðŸ”—](#PhysicalSkyMaterial_property_mie_coefficient)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_mie_coefficient**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_mie_coefficient**\ (\ )

Controls the strength of [Mie scattering](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mie_scattering) for the sky. Mie scattering results from light colliding with larger particles (like water). On earth, Mie scattering results in a whitish color around the sun and horizon.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicalSkyMaterial_property_mie_color"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Color](Color.md) **mie_color** = `Color(0.69, 0.729, 0.812, 1)` [ðŸ”—](#PhysicalSkyMaterial_property_mie_color)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_mie_color**\ (\ value\: [Color](Color.md)\ )
- [Color](Color.md) **get_mie_color**\ (\ )

Controls the [Color](Color.md) of the [Mie scattering](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mie_scattering) effect. While not physically accurate, this allows for the creation of alien-looking planets.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicalSkyMaterial_property_mie_eccentricity"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **mie_eccentricity** = `0.8` [ðŸ”—](#PhysicalSkyMaterial_property_mie_eccentricity)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_mie_eccentricity**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_mie_eccentricity**\ (\ )

Controls the direction of the [Mie scattering](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mie_scattering). A value of ``1`` means that when light hits a particle it's passing through straight forward. A value of ``-1`` means that all light is scatter backwards.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicalSkyMaterial_property_night_sky"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Texture2D](Texture2D.md) **night_sky** [ðŸ”—](#PhysicalSkyMaterial_property_night_sky)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_night_sky**\ (\ value\: [Texture2D](Texture2D.md)\ )
- [Texture2D](Texture2D.md) **get_night_sky**\ (\ )

[Texture2D](Texture2D.md) for the night sky. This is added to the sky, so if it is bright enough, it may be visible during the day.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicalSkyMaterial_property_rayleigh_coefficient"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **rayleigh_coefficient** = `2.0` [ðŸ”—](#PhysicalSkyMaterial_property_rayleigh_coefficient)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_rayleigh_coefficient**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_rayleigh_coefficient**\ (\ )

Controls the strength of the [Rayleigh scattering](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rayleigh_scattering). Rayleigh scattering results from light colliding with small particles. It is responsible for the blue color of the sky.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicalSkyMaterial_property_rayleigh_color"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Color](Color.md) **rayleigh_color** = `Color(0.3, 0.405, 0.6, 1)` [ðŸ”—](#PhysicalSkyMaterial_property_rayleigh_color)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_rayleigh_color**\ (\ value\: [Color](Color.md)\ )
- [Color](Color.md) **get_rayleigh_color**\ (\ )

Controls the [Color](Color.md) of the [Rayleigh scattering](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rayleigh_scattering). While not physically accurate, this allows for the creation of alien-looking planets. For example, setting this to a red [Color](Color.md) results in a Mars-looking atmosphere with a corresponding blue sunset.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicalSkyMaterial_property_sun_disk_scale"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **sun_disk_scale** = `1.0` [ðŸ”—](#PhysicalSkyMaterial_property_sun_disk_scale)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_sun_disk_scale**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_sun_disk_scale**\ (\ )

Sets the size of the sun disk. Default value is based on Sol's perceived size from Earth.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicalSkyMaterial_property_turbidity"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **turbidity** = `10.0` [ðŸ”—](#PhysicalSkyMaterial_property_turbidity)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_turbidity**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_turbidity**\ (\ )

Sets the thickness of the atmosphere. High turbidity creates a foggy-looking atmosphere, while a low turbidity results in a clearer atmosphere.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicalSkyMaterial_property_use_debanding"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **use_debanding** = `true` [ðŸ”—](#PhysicalSkyMaterial_property_use_debanding)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_use_debanding**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **get_use_debanding**\ (\ )

If ``true``, enables debanding. Debanding adds a small amount of noise which helps reduce banding that appears from the smooth changes in color in the sky.
